title: Republican attorneys general warn companies against ‘race-based quotas’
description: Citing the Supreme Court ruling against affirmative action, the chief legal officers said they would seek legal action against employers with such practices.

title: OpenAI strikes deal with AP to pay for using its news in training AI
description: OpenAI will pay the Associated Press for direct access to its archive of news stories in order to train its AI chatbots.

title: TikTok plastic surgeon who live-streamed procedures loses license
description: Katharine Roxanne Grawe, known on TikTok as "Dr. Roxy," is banned from practicing in Ohio after the medical board said she harmed patients while live-streaming.

title: Professors sue Texas over TikTok ban, signaling First Amendment fight
description: The Coalition for Independent Technology Research argues the ban infringes on academic freedoms and constitutional rights.

title: Twitter asks court to terminate FTC order governing its data practices
description: The company also asked the court to stay a deposition of Twitter owner Elon Musk.

title: That dangerous TikTok trend on the news? It’s fake.
description: The "boat jumping challenge" is just the latest hoax aimed at scaring adults about teen technology use.

title: How to make Threads work more like a good version of Twitter
description: Tips and tricks to help you navigate Meta's new social network, Threads.

title: The FTC is investigating whether ChatGPT harms consumers
description: The FTC is demanding documents from Open AI, ChatGPT's creator, about data security and whether its chatbot generates false information.

title: We tested some printers under $250. Here’s what we loved and hated about them.
description: Few facets of modern life suck more than printers, but they aren't all terrible. We tested some popular models to see which ones are worth living with.

title: You don’t need to own a printer. Do this instead.
description: Owning a home printer is so 2008. Most people can live perfectly happy lives without ever spending money on a printer or its ink by following these tips.
